abstract: In Japan’s second cell-phone merger this month, Fujitsu and Toshiba said Thursday they will merge their handset operations, as manufacturers here regroup to take on Apple’s increasingly popular iPhone at home as well as giants like Nokia and Samsung overseas.
snippet: In Japan’s second cell-phone merger this month, Fujitsu and Toshiba said Thursday they will merge their handset operations, as manufacturers here regroup to take on Apple’s increasingly popular iPhone at home as well as giants like Nokia and Samsu...
lead_paragraph: In Japan’s second cellphone merger this month, Fujitsu and Toshiba said Thursday they will merge their handset operations, as manufacturers here regroup to take on Apple‘s increasingly popular iPhone at home as well as giants like Nokia and Samsung overseas, Hiroko Tabuchi reports in The New York Times.

headline.main: Fujitsu and Toshiba to Merge Cellphone Units
